*div1 type="summary"* *p*John Durst to Austin, Nacogdoches, November 10, 1829. Asking Austin's advice concerning Guerrero's emancipation decree.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Nacogdochs */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="11-10-1829">Novr the 10th 1829*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*S. F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir We have receivd by last Mail a Decree Given by the *person_mentioned*excutive of our Governmt */person_mentioned*Liberating all the *person_mentioned*Slaves */person_mentioned*in its *location_mentioned*territory*/location_mentioned* I have so farr succeeded with the *person_mentioned*cival and Military othoraties*/person_mentioned* to Suspend its Publication and expose to the *person_mentioned*Governor */person_mentioned*the evil arrising from such Law should it have efect you no Doubt have it before this and I doubt nott you have taken Measures to Surpress it, in the Name of God what Shall we do for Gods Sake advise me on the subject by the return of Mail we are ruind for ever Should this Measure be adopted Yours*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John Durst [Rubric]*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
